definition: after all/to investigate/to study carefully/Taiwan pr. [jiu4]

sentences.english: So we must dig and delve unceasingly.
sentences.chinese: 所以我们必须不懈地探索深究。

sentences.english: Your minds could be recorded, but don't go deep into it.
sentences.chinese: 你的思想可以被记录下来，但是不要去深究它。

sentences.english: He was determined, indeed, to believe the best, but he seemed afraid to investigate.
sentences.chinese: 他的确坚信人性的善良，可是他似乎又不敢去深究。

sentences.english: I do not think it is going to move the ball forward.
sentences.chinese: 莫里路说，“我认为它不会在继续深究。

sentences.english: You want to take advantage of the service's output, not dig into how the service accomplished what it did.
sentences.chinese: 你应该利用服务的输出，而不深究服务如何完成工作。

sentences.english: He went ahead and wrote up an article, and he started submitting it to journals.
sentences.chinese: 他继续深究，并写了一篇文章发给一些期刊杂志。

sentences.english: Han and Tang's glory is not a sufficient reason for us to go into it.
sentences.chinese: 汉唐的辉煌并不足以成为我们必须深究它的原因。

sentences.english: Such manipulations are delved into in great detail in the materials in the self-study program for Group Mastery.
sentences.chinese: 这类操控在团队掌握的自学项目资料中被详细深究。

sentences.english: Morero said. “I do not think it is going to move the ball forward.
sentences.chinese: 莫里路说，“我认为它不会在继续深究。

definition: to get to the heart of the matter
to investigate/to delve/to probe/to enquire into/to look into
to question closely/to investigate in detail/to examine minutely/to get to the heart of the matter
lit. to examine roots and inquire at the base (idiom); to get to the bottom of sth
to show an interest in/to get involved with
to dig up roots and inquire at the base (idiom); to get to the bottom of sth
to say more than is necessary/to give unnecessary details
to lay bare in a few words/to expose with a word/to point out bluntly
